column4: does anybody know of a console word processor (not vi-like) that I can use to type RTF files or something
RTF is no no from console
or whatever I can do from console
there is nano
may sound but vim is superior nano is quick and dirty
how many colors do console support ?
16, console is for console
who said anything about colors?
I am trying to tell you can't expect everything from console, it has limitations and strengths, console is not a right place to seek for a full featured word process
worked in the 80s
like PW of DOS
you can install DOS box and try that old programs on it as well
I think no such editor exist for *nix
how top doesn't show it ?
i only see my naim session which is like 16%
tried ps  aux ?
when I run top, I can see the processes by root also
ps aux didnt list anything, but i killed my naim process and everything is good
how it didn't list anything ? ps is somewhat historical by the way ps aux --sort=gcpu | less sorts for cPU for example (ascending)
apparently that 25% was really like 78%
what 25 ?
nevermind. anyway that one process was using much more cpu than I noticed in top and ps
